name: Embassy Suites LAX North

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were looking for a place near the airport that had three features, and this hotel fit our needs perfectly. First, we needed a place that was really quiet, which is not always easy near an airport in a busy city. We also wanted the parking to be reasonably priced and fairly secure. And finally, we wanted a fantastic bed, because it doesn't matter how quiet the rooms are if the bed is uncomfortable. The rooms were spacious, the breakfast was included, and we would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Just what we needed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Some of the complaints from other customers (wi-fi costs extra unless you are Gold; shuttle had a hard-to-read sign) were known to us in advance or didn't matter to us.
reviews.title: Very Convenient to LAX, Free Hot Breakfast and Cocktail Reception
Hotel experience
reviews.text: We booked this hotel because it was close to LAX and had a shuttle. We called upon arrival and were informed the shuttle goes every 20 minutes or so, 24 hours a day. Soon a shuttle with Embassy Suites emblazoned all over it arrived, but it was for Embassy Suites LAX South. We continued to wait almost 45 minutes more (looking for a shuttle with Embassy Suites on it) when my wife noticed a nondescript shuttle had a flashing sign that alternated from HILTON-LAX to Embassy Suites North (in much smaller lettering). Once we arrived at the hotel the room was comfortable, the free hot breakfast was great as was the evening reception with free drinks. The problems we encountered were the room never really cooled down even though the thermostat was set on 60 and we had great difficulty getting the shower to work (the pull-up on the spigot was stuck and the shower head was stuck on pulsate.
For the price and convenience, it was a good value however - just make sure to watch for the proper shuttle!
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel.

reviews.text: Hotel was clean and staff friendly but unable to print in business area. Had to pay for internet because even though HHonors member but have to be gold or diamond member to receive free internet. Not use to that type of treatment in hotels so was very disappointed.
reviews.title: Good Option for LAX Layovers

reviews.text: I can't say enough good about our experience here. From the moment we flew into LAX, we were on the shuttle within 10 minutes and whisked to the hotel after a brief stop to leave off guests at it's sister hotel, the Hilton. Arriving at the front desk at 10:30 AM, we didn't expect to be able to check-in so early, but the very kind and helpful front desk clerk said she would see what she could do. After a brief, 10 minute wait she handed us our room keys. I'm sure they will not always be in a position to do such an early checkin, but we are grateful she made the extra effort to work with housekeeping in preparing our room.
reviews.title: All around great experience

reviews.text: The center of the hotel's interior is a large, green atrium with several floors of rooms that open on to it. In our room, the living area faced the atrium and the bedroom had a sliding door and small balcony facing the street. Although the hotel is on busy Airport Blvd. and close enough to see planes taxi on the runway, we didn't experience any noise from the street or airport (only occasional sirens typical of any city) once the slider door was shut.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: The rooms were very well decorated and appointed. Excellent linens and bath towels, variety of pillows, good lighting except in the bathroom, Loved the separate living area with sofa, desk and chair, large flat screen TV, wet bar, refrigerator, microwave and safe. The indoor pool area, open for 6AM-midnight, was nice size although being in southern CA, we would have preferred an outdoor one, it didn't stop us from enjoying it and the spa. The fitness center had excellent quality equipment including free weights.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: The complimentary breakfast was an amazing extra value including full omelet station, hot buffet, fresh waffles, lots of fresh fruit, pastries, cereals including hot oatmeal, yogurt, juices all served in the spacious and attractive atrium. If you like to start your day with an espresso or latte, they have them available for purchase at a very reasonable price.
reviews.title: Basically one hop, skip & a jump from the plane
Nice hotel close to Airport
reviews.text: Although the hotel's airport location doesn't have a lot of things to do or places to eat nearby, they do contract with a company that for $5 roundtrip, will take you to Manhatten Beach or El Segundo Beach so your not stuck in the middle of nowhere if you don't have a car.

I stayed here for 1 night on a business trip. The rooms at this Embassy Suites were very nice. Extremely large and well appointed accomodations. Complimentary bottled water for frequent traveler guests. Small, but nice exercise room. No free internet here. The staff provided a box breakfast since I had an early morning flight and would miss the free buffet. Great happy hour at this hotel. Clean rooms. Free shuttle to airport running every 1/2 hour starting at 4 am. Super convenient and within walking distance of numerous rental car locations. Reasonable corporate rate. I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Great for early morning departure!
A pleasant business hotel
reviews.text: Our committee stayed at Embassy Suites North LAX a single night in October '06. We used the hotel's meeting facilities.
The parking entrance was a bit hard to find. It is a narrow turn-in with a small sign on the north side of Airport St. Once I figured this out, parking was no problem.
reviews.title: Clean, Quiet and a Great Value

likes.disliked: — Need shuttle service every 15 minutes, instead of every 30

reviews.text: The desk staff was very friendly and accommodating. They let me check in a noon.
reviews.title: Good value for $$

reviews.text: My room was fine. Much more space than I am used to having in a business hotel.
reviews.title: Great stay & park package

likes.liked: — Convenience, shuttle to LAX, happy hour and breakfast
likes.disliked: — I wasn't informed that the return shuttle would not pick up at international terminal

reviews.text: Good value hotel. We have stayed quite a few times. Good if you are a family and want space. Clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: Good value hotel

reviews.text: I have stayed here twice - January and February. The rooms at this Embassy Suites were very nice. They are much larger than I expected. I've stayed in both the King Size and Two Queen bed rooms. Setup is almost the same in each room. Lots of mirrors in each room, which was very important for 4 women sharing. Nice dining area, refridgerator, microwave and coffee maker. 27 Inch TV provided in living room area and bedroom. The bathrooms are nice and big!
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay

likes.liked: — The size of the rooms, Happy Hour and the complimentary breakfast buffet.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They have an indoor pool and small business room They should put a time limit on the use of their two computers. Small, but nice exercise room. They have a convenient store to buy water, sodas, ice cream and traveling essentuals. They have a great Happy Hour! They also have an onsite restaurant and their complimentary breakfast buffet is just wonderful.
reviews.title: wonderful all round experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Their front desk personnel could take a class on how to smile and how to handle guests in a pleasant manner. Their other staff is just wonderful and very helpful and friendly. Can't say enough about them.
reviews.title: would never stay here again

reviews.text: Parking is a bit tight, but they make it work.
reviews.title: dismal - don't bother

reviews.text: The hotel was beautiful, the service great, the free breakfast quality and delicious. Top quality staff. Really very pleased. The bed and linens were wonderful, the sofa couch not the best. But it was ok.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: Embassy is the best Hotel in Los Angeles.. clean rooms, excellent staff and best cook to order Breakfast in Los Angeles... We stayed for 5 nights and our accommodations were excellent. The staff was very helpful and courteous to my entire family. They were helpful and assisted us on all areas needed..
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel and Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was an easy place to stay at near the airport. The shuttle was fairly prompt. The room was nice, clean and as quiet as it could be. Our room faced the main road so we did have some noise. There was a family reunion at the hotel so it was very busy. The breakfast was delicious. The evening wine was nice. We walked down to the Burger King our first night which was a big mistake. It was a homeless shelter that also sold burgers. It was really scary. Anyway, we didn't make that mistake again. Other than that, the hotel was great. I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: Room was recently renovated, well done with new mattress and sleek modern lights. I don't understand why the bedroom does not have a chair to sit down and put your shoes on. There is enough room for two chairs. Being there for business, I also think the eating table is too high for using a laptop for long periods of time. But that is my pet peeve with Embassy Suites in general. There should be a desk. The breakfast buffet and manager's reception are pretty standard per Embassy's standards. However I did not like the center courtyard area because it is a flagstone surface, rather rough, and with several steps up and down over the water feature to give it ambience. It is not suitable for a person with mobility issues. I was pleasantly surprised that there is no airplane noise (unlike the ES South), but unfortunately the street traffic is very noisy starting at 4 a.m. with busses and trucks headed into LAX. Finally the parking garage has a very steep and curvy entrance, more like an obstacle course to get in and out. Overall, this is OK if you are just stopping over near the airport for the night, but there are better choices in the area if you are there for several days for business.
reviews.title: Property has both pros and cons
Great location at LAX
reviews.text: Enjoyed a quick stay-over last night at this beautiful Embassy Suites. Prompt pick up at the airport, very speedy check in and a comfortable nights sleep were just what we were looking for. Rooms are spacious and in great condition, the whole hotel looks as if it was recently renovated. Breakfast this morning offered all the options you'd want from a cold continental to a hot buffet as well as cooked to order entrees. If we need to come back for an extended time period this is certainly where we would stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here last year, good spot for a layover. This year we will be coming and going at odd hours, not sure if we will be awake for breakfast. Does anyone know the breakfast hours? Any other good places nearby for breakfast or lunch?? Thanks.
reviews.title: Breakfast hours?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here on the last night of our vacation to be near the airport and Budget car rental. Our room #227 was very nice with a large cement balcony but no chairs. Happy hour drinks were good and not watered down and decent snacks. Ordered the Mahi meal at Aero Bistro and they were good about adjusting a few things altho the fish was a bit dry. Breakfast was crowded with long lines. I had to take my omlet back because the outside was so tough I could not cut it and the inside was cold. The next one was perfect tho. Shuttle to the airport was prompt.
reviews.title: Would stay again

reviews.text: Everything you could ask for. Great service, food, hospitality and overall friendliness by entire staff! We loved our stay and will stay again if the opportunity arises. The front desk attendants offered to call a rental service for us after we inquired about rentals in the area. That is only one example of how attentive the well trained Embassy employees are to their guest
reviews.title: What a great place to stay in LA

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 2 nights and were impressed with the staff from check in to check out. front desk, restaurant, morning buffet and evening happy hour, housekeeping staff all wonderful. Rooms are huge, with 2 room suite that includes a frig, wet bar, large double desk/table, 2 tvs (one in each room). usual morning cooked to order breakfast and great evening happy hour. Parking daily charge typical but its over $20 so be prepared for that extra charge. but you save on food and drinks. shuttle to airport which we didnt use. airport is very close. front desk gave us printed directions to nearest church. would come here again, its very easy to get to beaches, and on main highways from this location.
reviews.title: Great stay in LA

reviews.text: Tired grandparents and their tired daughter and tired pre-teen granddaughters were to arrive in Los Angeles, after 10:00 PM, from a 2 week vacation on the east coast. We needed a clean, comfortable, affordable hotel near the airport with a free shuttle and a free breakfast. We chose the Embassy Suites LAX North for all of the above reasons. We have had wonderful experiences with Embassy Suites in the past so our expectations were high and we were more than satisfied! The shuttle, which runs 24 hours every 15 minutes, picked us up promptly and the driver helped us with the tons of luggage we had. The two queens were very comfortable and so was the queen sofa bed, so much so that even Grandpa offered to sleep there! Breakfast is always incredible at Embassy Suites and this was no exception. Such beautiful surroundings, also! Booking as an AARP member, I got a 2 PM late check out. Our granddaughters tried to talk us into staying here instead of moving to a hotel in Santa Monica closer to our destinations. However, public transportation was available from near Embassy Suites to all over Los Angeles had we chosen that route. Bottom line, can't go wrong with Embassy Suites LAX North and I am sure we will stay there again. Oh, yeah, right by the airport and we didn't hear a plane!
reviews.title: More than met expectations and expectations were high!

reviews.text: I wish I had seen the review regarding parking being a potential issue for some travelers. If I had been informed by the hotel website when I booked that they had limited parking in their single floor parking garage and used another garage on the same block for "overflow" parking, I would not have booked here. As it turned out I lost time looking for a space in the hotel garage before being directed to the overflow garage. Unfortunately the overflow garage was fenced in. This made it difficult to find an exit for my young children (4 and 6 year-old) and me to walk through with our luggage. We then had to walk through a poorly lit alley behind the hotel to reach the front lobby. I would not have agreed to this for my family if I had known ahead of time. I did not feel safe. It would not have been as much of an issue for me as a single person. Although I received "complimentary" parking, a member of management was not on site to provide me with any further compensation. Overall, we lost an hour of time searching the original garage, finding the overflow garage, finding our way out of the overflow garage, and getting to the lobby to finally check-in! Unacceptable.
reviews.title: Parking was a significant problem

likes.liked: — i like the atrium architecture and the floor plan of the rooms.
likes.disliked: — The parking accomodations didn't work for us.

reviews.text: We arrived in LA from England late afternoon and wanted a stop off before travelling on to San Diego the next day, so booked the Embassy Suites after reading reviews on here. We found it friendly, clean and spacious, with a lovely breakfast which set us up nicely for the day. The free shuttle from the airport was very quick, and the next morning when we asked if we could be taken to the car hire offices (which are not in the airport grounds) this was no problem. For value and convenience, we would definitely recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent value

reviews.text: My wife and two teen age daughters stayed here for two nights while visiting Loyola Marymount University. We had two queen beds and a double fold out. The suite contained three sinks, a microwave, and refrigerator. The wifi internet worked very well, but there was a charge for 24 hours of about $5. The three rooms including bath, were
reviews.title: Great Value, lots of room good free food
Decent.
reviews.text: large but somewhat dark. The bedroom had a sliding glass door which could be fully opened if you wanted to listen to the airport which was just a couple blocks away. We all enjoyed the free cooked to order breakfasts and the manager reception each evening, where they would provide free cocktail, nachos and popcorn. The place was clean and pleasant. The indoor pool looked like it would be a lot of fun for parents with younger children. If you are visiting Loyola, tell them and they will give you a promo code which will save you a few buck.

We stayed in the Queen Suite (2 beds) on the 8th flr. Room and bathroom are large, clean, but not immaculate. Carpet had soils here and there. Balcony had the view of the runway. Walls are thin, we used foam earplugs and I could still hear the planes landing. Bed was comfortable, but not heavenly.
reviews.title: Great Value !!!!
Very nice, comfortable hotel
reviews.text: Overall I find the Embassy Suites North very nice and very comfortable. The evening manager's get together is nice and the breakfast is excellent, if your flight is not at 7 AM or earlier. With high security at the airport most guest have to be at the airport at least 2 hours early so most guest cannot use the free breakfast service, although the coffee, fruit, juice, and pastries become available around 5:30 AM.

The only disappointment is they charge for hgh speed internet when surrounding hotels supply high speed internet access for free. I just pull up to the window and use my wireless to access the Four Points Sheraton accross the street. There is also free free Wi-Fi in the area around the hotel so why do they charge their guests?
reviews.title: What a dump

likes.liked: — the location to the aiport for travel home
likes.disliked: — no outdoor pool for us to sit around as we had time before flying home and the poor repair of the hotel

aka: Embassy Suites Lax North Hotel Los Angeles
description: The Embassy Suites LAX North offers spacious suites near Los Angeles Intl Airport, and central to all that the greater Los Angeles area has to offer. Enjoy a complimentary cooked-to-order breakfast, evening Manager's Reception and 24-hour airport shuttle.
